de.hsrm.swt02.businesslogic

Class LogicImp

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.hsrm.swt02.businesslogic.LogicImp
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Logic

    public class LogicImp
extends Object
implements Logic
    This class implements the logic interface and is used for logic operations.

                          String username)
                            throws LogicException,
                                   PersistenceException
        Description copied from interface: Logic
        This method starts a Workflow. For starting a workflow, a user has to be in at least one of the roles owned by the workflow's startstep.
        Specified by:
        startWorkflow in interface Logic
        Parameters:
        workflowID - is the workflow, which should be started
        username - is the User, who starts the workflow
        Returns:
        logicResponse of starting a workflow
        Throws:
        LogicException - if an error in businesslogic occurs
        PersistenceException

      • addWorkflow

        public LogicResponse addWorkflow(Workflow workflow)
                          throws LogicException
        Description copied from interface: Logic
        This method stores a workflow and distributes a id. This method is used for saving a new workflow and for editting a workflow. It is also used for updating a workflow. If a completely new workflow should be saved it doesn't have an id (means it's null or ""). If a workflow is to be edited it already has an id. If a workflow doesn't have any unfinished items (or none at all) it will be overwritten. Otherwise the "original" workflow will be deactivated and a new workflow (with only steps, other attributes are reseted) will be saved. Should a workflow be de-/activated then its state will be setted on the original one which will be saved. For adding a workflow, admin rights are required.
        Specified by:
        addWorkflow in interface Logic
        Parameters:
        workflow - is the workflow which should be added
        Returns:
        logicResponse of adding a workflow
        Throws:
        LogicException - if an error in businesslogic occurs

        Description copied from interface: Logic
        This method checks the login data of a user. Username and password will always be checked. When logging in via the adminClient(adminRequired flag), admin rights will be checked in addition.
        Specified by:
        checkLogIn in interface Logic

      • updateItem

        public LogicResponse updateItem(Item item,
                       String username)
                         throws LogicException
        Description copied from interface: Logic
        Method for updating an item. Suitable item from a workflow in persistence will be overwritten. For updating an item, the user needs to have a role owned by the item and needs to be correctly logged in.
        Specified by:
        updateItem in interface Logic
        Parameters:
        item - contains changes, will be used to overwrite item in workflow
        username - indicates user who wants to update item
        Returns:
        logicResponse which contains update notification
        Throws:
        LogicException - if an error in persistence occurs
